comment_body: Great post !

I have been arguing over so many posts that Archer is not too big a loss even if he is not 100%. Likes of Hasaranga and Parag and Hetty are more vital to us. 

It is just that the 11 need to perform the best they can. And I am sure Dravid will manage to get the best out of them

Starc also  performed in the knockouts only kkr's most important player was narine. Also if i am not wrong we were carrying prasidh as a load because of his injury for last 2 seasons for about 10 cr and still ended up getting better bowler sandeep(i think so). We will only miss out on archers all round ability.
Felt it needed while replying to you üòÇ‚ù§Ô∏è

my  bad
Bruh wtf is this calculation üò≠

Releasing boult buying jofra

Waittt MI did the same mistake and paid the price and guess what we were dumb enough to repeat the same mistake. 

I say again with players like Jofra, strac, Chahar, Wood there is never certainty of fitness nor form. 

Glad that we bought farooqui.

The above is kind of close to worst case scenario . But I believe if our players are fit the we can perform like below.

Jofra 3 Overs in PP : 30 Runs and 1-2 Wickets

Sandeep 2 Overs in PP : 15 Runs and 1-2 Wickets

Teekshna 1 Over in PP : 8 Runs and 0-1 Wickets

So Overall if we take 2-3 wickets in PP then no problem as latter Hasranga, Teekshna, Sandy, Madhwal will keep them under pressure and take wickets regularly then opposition can't score much. So final score will be like

Jofra 40/2, Sandeep 30/2, Hasranga 35/2, Teekshna 30/1, Madhwal 35/2, So Total = 170 and on most days we  should chase this.

The problem will come if we don't take wickets in PP, I hope that this case should be 2-3 match out of 14 only. Then

Jofra 50/1, Sandeep 35/2, Hasranga 35/1, Teekshna 35/1, Madhwal 45/2, So Total = 200 and worst case 215 if Sandeep, Hasranga, Teekshna all 3 also goes for 40 runs.

\- So These are the situation guys Hope so most of days we take wickets in PP then need to chase below 170-175.

And only 2-3 matches in bad days we need to chase 200-220.

>**I believe Our season will depend more on How our Batting Unit performs as our Top 4 are coming from Injuries Jaiswal, Sanju, Rana, Parag. If they perform consistently and one of Hetty/Dubey finishes well then we are good otherwise we are cooked**

I think we should go with Farooqi instead

Archer is bowling higher % of hit-me balls since his injury. He is still effective but there is always couple of loose balls in every over. Usually that is considered sin in T-20. Earlier Archer was very close to Bumrah, giving hardly 2-3 "hit-me" balls in the entire spell. 
Also, Mark Wood is outperforming him in almost every match when they play together in terms of speed and accuracy both. Wood would have gone for 8Cr+ easily had English board allowed him to put his name.
What can be done now? Any ray of hope?
He actually bowled slower in powerplay to avoid the risk of edging in powerplay, so he is adapting and hopefully will find consistency in length as well as his rhythm back.

Going for runs is not a problem in the powerplay if we get wickets just like boult did against srh in semis. And for death overs we have sandeep and he will not disappoint. Concern is that who will play as the third pacer. I want yudhvir to play as he bats too.¬†
